page.title: 05BRADNOP'S MEETING HALL.
page.content: The village of Bradnop has a disused school building in the centre which is now used as a meeting place. I, Stephen Robinson, used to be a pupil at the school until it was closed down in l978. We all tried to save the school by raising money and making a nationwide television appeal. However, we were unsuccessful. The building has two rooms which are sometimes used for parish meetings and whist drives. On a regular, weekly basis the building is used for a Youth Club. The Youth Club has pool and snooker facilities. It is run by David Taylor a local teacher. The club is open from 8.00pm.-10.00pm. every Friday evening. It is hoped that some trips can be arranged to local places of interest eg. Alton Towers.
